newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft ends Money software bank fees.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft ends Money software bank fees.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. Thursday said it has eliminated all user fees charged to financial institutions that offer customers online banking and bill payment through Microsoft Money software.

By eliminating the fees, Microsoft believes more financial institutions will adopt online banking, resulting in increased banking options and potentially reduced costs for consumers, it said in a statement.
This decision will help support the current trend among financial institutions to offer online services free to their customers, the Redmond, Wash.-based company said.

More than 80 banks and financial institutions offer home banking services to Money software users through direct connections to the Internet, private dial-up or private networks with home banking processors.
Microsoft's stock rose $1.375 to $95.625 on Nasdaq, where it was among the most active issues at mid-morning.
